section.name: Upgrading from Silverpeas 5.1 to Silverpeas 5.2
section.p:
Before Silverpeas 5.2 there were two configuration files, with Silverpeas 5.2 the file SilverpeasSettings.xml has been splitted in two. Now you will find config.xml containing the part that has to be manually edited and SilverpeasSettings.xml which provides a default configuration for Silverpeas, overriden by creating a CustomerSettings.xml.
If you don't have your own CustomerSettings.xml, all you have to do is copy the SilverpeasSettings.xml and redefine your configuration.

On the Windows plateform another step is requied, you have to reinstall JBoss with the new package or you have to manually edit the %JBOSS_HOME%\bin\run.bat file and remove the line 77 (or add a rem before the command) : set JAVA_OPTS=%JAVA_OPTS% -Xms512m -Xmx512m

section.name: Pre-requisite
section.p: Silverpeas V5 can be installed over the last stable version of Silverpeas V4, a.k.a. Silverpeas V4 P410-M3. As Silverpeas V5 has only the migration scripts from this version, you must upgrade to Silverpeas V4 P410-M3 before any migration to Silverpeas V5.

subsection.name: Preparing the new installation
subsection.p:
Silverpeas needs a Java SE Development Kit (JDK) at least of version 6, which can be downloaded from Sun here.
Don't forget to set-up the environment variable %JAVA_HOME%.

subsection.name: Apache Maven
subsection.p:
Apache Maven 2.2.x is used in Silverpeas for the building of components and the assembly. It must be installed on the target platform.
For correct installation, see Maven - The Definitive Guide
For more information about Apache Maven, please see the their website or download the ebook

subsection.name: Environment Variables
subsection.p: In order for Silverpeas V5 to run ,the follwing environment variables must have been set :

ul.li: %SILVERPEAS_HOME% : pointing to the installation directory of Silverpeas.
%$JBOSS_HOME% : pointing to the installation directory of JBoss.

subsection.p: These variables should be available to the user running Silverpeas. With FireDaemon on Windows that means that the variables should be set as system variables.

subsection.name: Configuring Silverpeas
subsection.p:
Now, you have to edit your configuration file : %SILVERPEAS_HOME%\setup\settings\CustomerSettings.xml in order to take into account your new environment. The configuration is quite simple : you have to replace all $SILVERPEAS_HOME\silverpeas\ with $SILVERPEAS_HOME\.
In order to keep your existing data, you have to edit the provided %SILVERPEAS_HOME%\setup\settings\SilverpeasSettings.xml to define the correct directory to your data root directory.
